hours.question: What are your office hours?
hours.answer: Excel Cardiac Care is open Monday through Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, and we are closed on Saturdays and Sundays.

locations.question: Where are your clinics located?
locations.answer: We see patients at two cardiology clinics: 4400 Heritage Trace Pkwy, Suite 208, Keller, TX 76244 and 1502 S FM 51, Suite B, Decatur, TX 76234.

phone_numbers.question: What phone number should I call?
phone_numbers.answer: You can call either of our main lines—817-518-9005 (Keller) or 940-799-3580 (Decatur). If you reach voicemail, please leave your name, date of birth, and best callback number.

providers.question: Who are the cardiologists?
providers.answer: Our cardiovascular team includes Dr. Saritha Dodla, MD, RPVI, FACC and Dr. Abdul Basit, MD, FACC, FSCAI. Both provide comprehensive heart and vascular care.

services.question: What services do you provide?
services.answer: We diagnose and treat a full spectrum of heart and vascular conditions, and provide in-office testing such as vascular ultrasounds, echocardiograms, stress testing, and other cardiology procedures.

appointments.question: How do I schedule an appointment?
appointments.answer: Call 817-518-9005 or 940-799-3580, or I can gather your details and have our scheduling team reach out with cardiology availability that fits your needs.

new_patient.question: Do you accept new patients?
new_patient.answer: Yes—we’re accepting new cardiology patients. Please bring your insurance card, photo ID, current medication list, and arrive 15 minutes early to complete any forms.

insurance.question: What insurance do you accept?
insurance.answer: We work with most major insurance plans. Because coverage varies, please call our office and we’ll confirm benefits, or visit the Forms & Insurance section on our website for details.

forms.question: Where can I find patient forms?
forms.answer: Visit the Forms & Insurance section of our website to download clinic forms, office policies, prescription refill instructions, and bill pay links.

portal.question: Do you have a patient portal?
portal.answer: Yes—our patient portal lets you review results, send secure messages, and request refills. Let us know if you need an invitation email to enroll.

prescriptions.question: How do I request a prescription refill?
prescriptions.answer: Submit refill requests through your pharmacy or the patient portal. Please allow up to 48 business hours; urgent cardiac medication refills should be called in directly.

after_hours.question: What if I need help after hours?
after_hours.answer: If you develop urgent but non-emergent symptoms after 5 PM, call our main number and follow the prompts to reach the on-call provider. Dial 911 for any chest pain, shortness of breath, or emergency symptoms.

billing.question: Who can help me with billing questions?
billing.answer: Call our main line during business hours and ask for the billing team—they can help with statements, insurance questions, and payment plans.
